Extracted from #6718.

nodes.body: @eric-wieser I didn't see how to apply your suggestions immediately; if you have a moment to share some more details, that would be appreciated, but if not, I'm happy to poke some more.
If you use one of the `lift` functions can you avoid needing to prove the `map_mul'`?
Isn't this just `map_one`? (aka not a useful lemma)
I think you can get here more quickly via `AlgHom.ofLinearMap` (or similar) and using the linear version of `Finsupp.mapRange`

We should probably use [AddMonoidAlgebra.mapDomainRingHom](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/Basic.html#AddMonoidAlgebra.mapDomainRingHom) (found via [loogle](https://loogle.lean-fro.org/?q=AddMonoidAlgebra+_+_+%E2%86%92%2B*+AddMonoidAlgebra+_+_)) to construct this; for `k` non-commutative this is not covered by [AddMonoidAlgebra.domCongr](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/MonoidAlgebra/Basic.html#AddMonoidAlgebra.domCongr).
This falls out trivially from `domCongr` with `(k := Nat) (A := k)`, though perhaps that's not a satisfying way to get it.

Indeed! I've forgotten we can take `k := Nat` rather than `k`, even though I've [used this trick before](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/17401/files#diff-a97e4b387e41d31d3f5467f44ef6cf00d77f7278449af9d55821b61a2f4affc0L1345-R1340) to generalize to the noncommutative setting. Now I'm confused: what's not satisfying about it?

Usually we build stronger bundlings from weaker bundlings (as in general this scales), rather than building the strongest one first and recovering the weaker one as a special case.

I suspect though that no one needs the weaker one in the first place...

The content of this and `mapDomainAlgAut` below is basically the `comp`/`trans` and `id`/`refl` lemmas I mentioned [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6718#discussion_r1328008953), so one more reason to add them. Maybe we could do with these lemmas without making them bundled morphisms?
@negiizhao, is this the only result you actually need in #6718? If so, I'd be inclined not to both with all the `Ring` versions of things, since you wanted the algebra version anyway.

pullRequest.title: feat: Equivs for AddMonoidAlgebras

nodes.body: @eric-wieser I didn't see how to apply your suggestions immediately; if you have a moment to share some more details, that would be appreciated, but if not, I'm happy to poke some more.

source.title: feat(LinearAlgebra/DirectSum/Finsupp) : tensor products of finsupp functions
